p: In summary, C. longa exhibited cholagogic effects by increasing the production and secretion of total bile acids in high-fat diet-induced rats. However, there are no animal models induced by bile duct ligation or related to liver cirrhosis for evaluating the efficacy of C. longa. Therefore, different models stimulated by drugs, alcohol, autoimmune inflammation, viral infections, etc., are required to assess the pharmacological effects of C. longa in the treatment of cholestasis-induced dysfunctions.
